articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Veteran Educators
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Birthday Spreads to Veteran Educators
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- Marshal Kim Jong Un sent birthday spreads to Merited Scientist and Candidate Academician, Prof. and Dr. Ri Thae Hyong, teacher at Kim Chaek University of Technology, on his 70th birthday, and Dr. and Associate Prof. Ri Kyong Ju, researcher at Ri Kye Sun Sariwon University of Education No. 1, on his 80th birthday.
					 Born into a family of an office worker in Manho-ri, Myongchon County, North Hamgyong Province, Ri Thae Hyong graduated from Kim Chaek University of Technology under the warm loving care of the great leaders an has devoted all his wisdom and energy to the education of students and scientific researches for several decades. 
					
					 Born into a worker's family in Kimhwa County, Kangwon Province before the country's liberation, Ri Kyong Ju experienced bitter sorrow as a member of the stateless nation. He has devoted himself to educating students with his single desire to repay with loyalty the profound solicitude shown by President Kim Il Sung for him after liberating the country.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Calls for Propelling Great Advance in Heroic Spirit of Sangwon Workers
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Calls for Propelling Great Advance in Heroic Spirit of Sangwon Workers
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The Korean revolution is more dynamically advancing by dint of the great might of the heroic Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il workers who are following and defending the Workers' Party of Korea single-mindedly, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an editorial. It goes on:
					 The workers of the Sangwon Cement Complex produced last year tens of thousands of tons of more cement than that in the peak year in production, a clear demonstration of the revolutionary disposition of the Korean working class going through thick and thin in response to the call of the party and the leader.
					
					 It is the unshakable faith of the Korean workers to more strikingly demonstrate the highest dignity and honor of the Korean working class going by the august name of the great leaders.
					
					 The Sangwon workers surpassed last year the peak year in production of cement with the firm faith that to make a signal boost in the cement production means implementing the behests of the leaders and defending the party policies. Their spirit and mettle clearly show how to exalt the greatest honor of being the heroic Kim Il Sung-Kim Jong Il workers.
					
					 When the torch of the drive for surpassing the peak year in production at the Sangwon Cement Complex flares up across the country to be a more intensive campaign, the enemy's moves to render the DPRK further isolated and ratchet up the sanction and pressure on it are bound to go bankrupt by the self-development of Juche Korea, and the glory will be store in the road indicated by the party.
					
					 The success made by them in surpassing the peak year in production precisely means the defence of the revolution and the greatest labor gift to the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea. It is like thrusting daggers into the heads of the imperialist reactionary forces.
					
					 The editorial calls upon all the workers to share idea and intention with the party just as the Sangwon workers did and turn out as one in the drive to usher in a golden era in building a thriving nation.

articles.title: Worst Crisis in S. Korea, Inevitable Product of Sycophantic and Treacherous Politics: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Worst Crisis in S. Korea, Inevitable Product of Sycophantic and Treacherous Politics: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- Political confusion and contradictions have reached an extreme phase in south Korea, throwing the whole society into the worst crisis and touching off public anger, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 Greatly infuriated by the outcome of the negotiations between the south Korean and Japanese authorities on the crimes related to the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army, south Korean people of various circles are condemning the conservative group for conniving at the past crimes of Japan, and rising up in massive actions to nullify the humiliating "agreement". 
					
					 Meanwhile, the Federation of Trade Unions declared the retraction of the "great compromise among the workers, business and government" and stop to dialogue in token of the protest against the conservative authorities keen on passing the unpopular bill "on labor reform" through the "National Assembly" in disregard of the will of the workers, giving further momentum to the anti-"government" struggle.
					
					 It is quite natural that politics is bound to be in mayhem, economy in the grip of crisis and massive actions are gaining in scope and strength in such corrupt and ailing unpopular society as south Korea.
					
					  The present crisis is a natural product of the unprecedented unpopular politics pursued by the sycophants and traitors while selling off the interests and dignity of the nation to foreign forces, subservient to them.
					
					 South Korea cannot exist even a day without depending on foreign forces. Herein lie the instability of the south Korean regime and vulnerability of its colonial system.
					
					 The south Korean society is going to ruin due to sycophancy and treachery and is torn off due to corruption and irregularities. Only graves of history wait for the traitors as they have turned south Korea into a veritable hell by enforcing an unpopular rule.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Posted by Italian Organization
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Posted by Italian Organization
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The full text of the New Year Address made by Marshal Kim Jong Un was posted by the Italy-DPRK Association for Friendship and Solidarity on its website on Jan. 10.
					 It was illustrated with a photo of Kim Jong Un making his New Year Address.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Brazilian Organization and Indian Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's New Year Address Supported by Brazilian Organization and Indian Figure
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The New Year Address made by Marshal Kim Jong Un was supported by an organization of Brazil and an Indian figure.
					 The Brazilian Committee for Remembering Leader Kim Jong Il in a statement on Jan. 15 voiced full support for the revolutionary and grandiose goals and tasks advanced by Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address for accelerating the building of a thriving socialist nation and national reunification.
					
					 Framoda Patel, director of the Indian Institute for Foreign Policy Studies, said in a statement on Jan. 19:
					
					 HE Kim Jong Un in his New Year Address called for rejecting foreign interference and independently settling the issues of the inter-Korean relations and Korea's reunification in line with the desire and wishes of the nation. 
					
					 The proposal made by him for reunifying Korea is the most fair and reasonable one as it makes it possible to achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country by the concerted efforts of the Koreans.
					
					 I wish all Koreans bigger success this year in their struggle for meeting the challenges of the anti-reunification forces at home and abroad and ushering in a fresh era of independent reunification.

articles.title: Day of Sun and Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Venezuela
articles.content:
Day of Sun and Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Venezuela
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- A Venezuelan preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Sun and the Day of the Shining Star (birth anniversaries of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il) was formed in Maracay City, Aragua State on Jan. 19.
					 Omar Lopez, chairman of the Venezuelan National Society for the Study of the Juche Idea, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold diverse political and cultural events to praise the revolutionary careers and exploits of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Egypt
articles.content:
Day of Shining Star to Be Celebrated in Egypt
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- An Egyptian preparatory committee for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star (birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il) was formed in Cairo on Jan. 19.
					 Yehia Zakaria Khairullah, vice-chairman of the Socialist Freedom Party of Egypt and chairman of the Egypt-Korea Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to significantly organize political and cultural events such as seminar, photo and book exhibition and film show from Jan. 19 to Feb. 16.

articles.title: British Newspaper Accuses U.S. of Threatening World Peace
articles.content:
British Newspaper Accuses U.S. of Threatening World Peace 
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- It is none other than the U.S. imperialists who are threatening world peace.
					 The Jan. 15th issue of The New Worker, organ of the New Communist Party of Britain, said this in an editorial hailing the DPRK's successful H-bomb test.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The U.S. is letting loose any rhetoric to justify its double standards while talking volumes about the conception of nuclear deterrent and morality of nuclear weapons
					
					 The U.S. missile shield is sparking off a fresh arms race.
					
					 The imperialists are now making no report on the DPRK's promise not to be the first to use nuclear weapons.
					
					 The DPRK is posing no threat to anyone but the U.S. imperialists are pursuing the goal to perpetuate the division of Korea and finally bring down the socialist system in the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The warships with U.S. nuclear weapons aboard are always operating in the waters off the Korean Peninsula and the U.S. forces are present in south Korea and Japan.

articles.title: White Paper of Korean Jurists Committee Carried by Ugandan Newspaper
articles.content:
White Paper of Korean Jurists Committee Carried by Ugandan Newspaper
 Pyongyang, January 24 (KCNA) -- The Jan. 18th issue of the Ugandan newspaper Red Paper carried the detailed gist of the white paper issued by the Korean Jurists Committee in an article titled "The DPRK denounces the U.S. for sidestepping the conclusion of a peace treaty".
					 It said that the committee disclosed the intention of the U.S. which is persistently shunning the conclusion of a peace treaty with the DPRK.
